metadata.title: CVE-2020-10711 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel's SELinuxsubsystem in versions before 5.7. This flaw occurs while importing theCommercial IP Security Option (CIPSO) protocol's category bitmap into theSELinux extensible bitmap via the' ebitmap_netlbl_import' routine. Whileprocessing the CIPSO restricted bitmap tag in the 'cipso_v4_parsetag_rbm'routine, it sets the security attribute to indicate that the categorybitmap is present, even if it has not been allocated. This issue leads to aNULL pointer dereference issue while importing the same category bitmapinto SELinux. This flaw allows a remote network user to crash the systemkernel, resulting in a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10711` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-aws - 4.4.0-1074.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.78').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~14.04.1').
